newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Satellite to buy satellite from Hughes Space.
newsitem.headline: Japan Satellite to buy satellite from Hughes Space.

text.p: Japan Satellite Systems Inc said on Monday that it would buy a satellite from Hughes Space and Communications International Inc, a unit of Hughes Electronics Corp.
It will be the Japanese company's sixth satellite.
The satellite, an HS-601 model, will be launched at the end of June, 1998, using a Lockheed Martin Commercial Launch Service Inc rocket, Japan Satellite said in a statement.
Japan Satellite is owned by a Japanese consortium led by trading houses including Itochu Corp and Mitsui & Co Ltd. It owns and manages satellites.
A Japan Satellite spokeswoman declined to give details of the cost of the satellite and launch costs but she said that generally such projects cost 25 to 30 billion yen.
The satellite, which will be used for digital broadcasting by Japan Sky Broadcasting Co (JSkyB), will cover the whole of Japan, the spokeswoman said.
JSkyB was formed last year by media tycoon Rupert Murdoch's News Corp and Japan's Softbank Corp.
